title: By selling 150 mangoes, a fruit seller gains the selling price of 30 mangoes. What is his gain percentage? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let the CP of 1 mango be x CP of 150 mangoes+SP of 30 mangoes = SP of 150 mangoes Hence CP of 150 mangoes= SP of 150-30=120 mangoes. SP/CP= 150/120 Profit= 30 CP =120. Profit%=25%
Let’s say Selling price of 1 mango is X so, selling price of 150 mangoes = 150X profit (or gain) = 30X so, cost price = 150X - 30X = 120X Gain % = gain/ cost price = 30X / 120X = 1/4 = 25%
